src:
Sánchez matiza sus palabras sobre la Fiscalía y Puigdemont le insta a rectificar
06 Nov 2019, 17:09 by Diariocrítico
El Ministerio Fiscal ha abroncado al presidente del Gobierno en funciones Pedro Sánchez por presumir de que la Fiscalía depende del Gobierno. Así se ha pronunciado al ser preguntado por su promesa de traer de vuelta al ex president Carles Puigdemont, fugado desde 2017. Ante el aluvión de críticas, Sánchez ha matizado sus palabras asegurando que el Ejecutivo respalda a los fiscales y Puigdemont le ha reprochado que "se vuelve a equivocar", al tiempo que ha negado ser un prófugo de la Justicia como asegura el socialista.
Sánchez ha dado a entender que la Fiscalía depende del poder ejecutivo, a pesar de que nuestro sistema se rige por la separación de los tres poderes. Lo ha hecho para presumir de que podrá conseguir que el ex presidente catalán Carles Puigdemont se presente ante la Justicia española. Sus palabras han provocado el malestar del Ministerio Fiscal, que ha reivindicado su independencia e imparcialidad al tiempo que ha denunciado que "no se ajustan a la realidad y generan en la ciudadanía una confusión inaceptable".
Ante las críticas de la oposición y la Fiscalía, Sánchez ha querido matizar sus declaraciones a través de Twitter. "Nadie está por encima de la ley. Puigdemont es un prófugo de la Justicia. Trabajaremos para que el sistema judicial español, con todas sus garantías, pueda juzgarlo con imparcialidad. La Fiscalía cuenta con el respaldo del Gobierno en la defensa de la Ley y del interés general".
El ex presidente catalán no ha tardado en responder al presidente del Gobierno y le ha instado a rectificar, al igual que ha hecho tras afirmar que Moncloa controla a la Fiscalía. "Se vuelve a equivocar. No soy ningún prófugo de la justicia. Estoy en manos de la justicia belga, como debería saber, que decretó mi libertad sin fianza. Y que debe resolver. Si eso quería ser una rectificación de su grave metedura de pata, vuélvalo a intentar".
text:
Sánchez clarifies his words about the Prosecutor's Office and Puigdemont urges him to rectify
06 Nov 2019, 17:09 by Diariocritical
The Prosecutor's Office has registered the President of the acting Government Pedro Sánchez for presuming that the Prosecutor's Office depends on the Government. This has been pronounced when asked about his promise to bring back former President Carles Puigdemont, escaped since 2017. Faced with the flood of criticism, Sanchez has qualified his words ensuring that the Executive backs prosecutors and Puigdemont has reproached him that " he is wrong again ", while denying being a fugitive from Justice as the socialist assures.
Sanchez has implied that the Prosecutor's Office depends on the executive branch, although our system is governed by the separation of the three powers. He has done so to presume that he can get former Catalan President Carles Puigdemont to appear before the Spanish Justice. His words have caused the malaise of the Fiscal Ministry, which has claimed its independence and impartiality while denouncing that "they do not conform to reality and generate an unacceptable confusion in the public".
Faced with criticism from the opposition and the Prosecutor's Office, Sánchez wanted to clarify his statements through Twitter. "Nobody is above the law. Puigdemont is a fugitive from Justice. We will work so that the Spanish judicial system, with all its guarantees, can judge it impartially. The Prosecutor's Office has the backing of the Government in defense of the Law and of general interest. "
The former Catalan president has been quick to respond to the president of the Government and has urged him to rectify, as he has done after stating that Moncloa controls the Prosecutor's Office. "He is wrong again. I am no fugitive from justice. I am in the hands of Belgian justice, as I should know, that he decreed my freedom without bail. And that he must resolve. If that wanted to be a rectification of his grave blunder , try again. "
